abstract: Russian political opposition leader Aleksei A Navalny frees himself from house arrest by removing bracelet used to monitor his movements, raising possibility that he may be punished further by authorities; explains in online statement that he did so to protest unexplained technicalities that kept him detained after receiving three-and-a-half year suspended sentence for criminal embezzlement charges.
lead_paragraph: Mr. Navalny, the Russian political opposition leader, removed the electronic bracelet used to monitor his whereabouts, raising the possibility that the authorities would punish him.
snippet: Mr. Navalny, the Russian political opposition leader, removed the electronic bracelet used to monitor his whereabouts, raising the possibility that the authorities would punish him.

headline.main: Aleksei Navalny, Defying Kremlin Again, Declares End to House Arrest
headline.print_headline: Prominent Kremlin Critic Again Defies Authorities
